newsitem.title: USA: Enron reports 22 percent increase in profits.
newsitem.headline: Enron reports 22 percent increase in profits.

text.p: Enron Corp. said Thursday its profits grew by 22 percent in the third quarter on strong earnings growth by its natural gas marketing and pipeline service operations.

Enron, one of the world's largest integrated natural gas and electricity companies, said its net income in the three months ended Sept. 30 expanded to $122.9 million, or 48 cents a share, from $100.6 million, or 40 cents a share.
The Houston-based company said its third-quarter revenues soared to $3.2 billion from $2.2 billion on strong increases in volume sales of natural gas and electricity.

"As natural gas and electricity markets converge, (our) unique ability to tailor broad based commodity solutions to meet customer needs has been extremely successful," Chairman Kenneth L. Lay said in a statement.
Enron operates the largest natural gas transmission system in the Western Hemisphere and the second-largest in the world. It also produces and markets natural gas liquids worldwide.
For the first nine months, Enron said net income grew by 16 percent to $452.4 million, or $1.79 a share, from $389.6 million, or $1.55 a share.
Revenues for the nine months ballooned to $9.2 billion from $6.6 billion.

The company also said it expected to resume full-scale construction on its power project in Dabhol, India, in the very near future, after resolution of the only remaining lawsuit related to the once-controversial project
It also said it had completed financing on a power project in Turkey and construction had begun.
Enron's stock lost 25 cents to $41.125 in late morning trading on the New York Stock Exchange.
